    • Method Detail

      • connectTo

        public VirtualizationToolManager connectTo(PhysicalMachine physicalMachine)
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::connectTo(PhysicalMachine).

        For each physical machine connection operation are used 3 attempts to establish the connection. Between each unsuccessful attempt is set up the waiting time to 2 seconds.

        If there occurs any failure during the processing the connection operation, there can be thrown one of the following exceptions:

        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given physical machine is null
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there cannot be the connection with the physical machine established and one of the following problems occur:
          1. Physical machine given as the input parameter of this method has some key value (IP address, port number of VirtualBox web server, username and user password) incorrect.
          2. VirtualBox web server is not running at the moment of the connection establishment.
          3. Network connection is not working properly or at all.
        • IncompatibleVirtToolAPIVersionException - thrown when the API version of VirtualBox installation on the physical machine, which there is being established the connection with, is incorrect (different from the correct API version 4.3).
        Specified by:
        connectTo in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        physicalMachine - represents the physical machine which is going to be connected
        Returns:
        manager of type VirtualizationToolManager for managing virtual machines on the newly connected physical machine

      • connectTo

        public VirtualizationToolManager connectTo(PhysicalMachine physicalMachine,
                                           long millis)
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::connectTo(PhysicalMachine, long).

        This method use the same implementation as the method connectTo(PhysicalMachine).

        With this method is possible specified the wating time between the unsuccessful connection establishment attempts. If the given time in milliseconds is negative, then it indicates that there will be performed just one attempt to establish the connection with a particular physical machine.

        Specified by:
        connectTo in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        physicalMachine - represents the physical machine which is going to be connected
        millis - time in milliseconds determining the waiting time between each unsuccessful connection establishment attempt
        Returns:
        manager of type VirtualizationToolManager for managing virtual machines on the newly connected physical machine

      • disconnectFrom

        public void disconnectFrom(PhysicalMachine physicalMachine)
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::disconnectFrom(PhysicalMachine).

        The given physical machine is just removed from the list of connected physical machines.

        If there occurs any failure during the processing the disconnection operation, there can be thrown one of the following exceptions:

        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given physical machine is null
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the given physical machine is not connected
        Specified by:
        disconnectFrom in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        physicalMachine - represents the physical machine which is going to be disconnected

      • disconnectFrom

        public void disconnectFrom(PhysicalMachine physicalMachine,
                           ClosingActionType closingAction)
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::disconnectFrom(PhysicalMachine, ClosingActionType).

        If there occurs any failure during the processing the disconnection operation, there can be thrown one of the following exceptions:

        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the either given physical machine or closing action type is null
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when the disconnection operation cannot be performed correctly because of the following problems:
          1. the given physical machine is not connected,
          2. the given physical machine has incorrect key value (IP address, poort number of VirtualBox web server, username or user password),
          3. remote VirtualBox web server is not running,
          4. network connection is not working properly or at all.
          IncompatibleVirtToolAPIVersionException - thrown when the API version of VirtualBox installation on the physical machine, has been changed to incorrect version (different from the correct API version 4.3).
        Specified by:
        disconnectFrom in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        physicalMachine - represents the physical machine which is going to be disconnected
        closingAction - specifies what action should be performed before the physical machine is disconnected

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(PhysicalMachine physicalMachine)
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::isConnected(PhysicalMachine). If there occurs any error during the method is being processed, the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given physical machine is null.
        Specified by:
        isConnected in interface ConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        physicalMachine - represents the queried physical machine
        Returns:
        true if the physical machine is connected, false otherwise

      • getConnectedPhysicalMachines

        public java.util.List<PhysicalMachine> getConnectedPhysicalMachines()
        Method implements the method ConnectionManager::getConnectedPhysicalMachines().
        Specified by:
        getConnectedPhysicalMachines in interface ConnectionManager
        Returns:
        list of all connected physical machines

      • close

        public void close()
        Method that implements the method ConnectionManager::close().
        In this method is called for each connected physical machine the disconnection method disconnectFrom(PhysicalMachine, ClosingActionType) with closing action set up to shut down all running virtual machines on a particular physical machine.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ConnectionManager
